meanings.definition: A pattern of squares or rectangles in alternating colors
meanings.sent1: The tablecloth had a chequer design with red and white squares.
meanings.sent2: I love the chequer pattern on that quilt.
meanings.sent3: The chef created a chequer pattern on the cake using chocolate and vanilla frosting.
meanings.sent4: The city streets formed a chequer grid from above.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a chequer background to make the flowers pop.

meanings.definition: To mark with a pattern of squares or rectangles
meanings.sent1: She decided to chequer the wall with blue and green paint.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will chequer the floor with different colored tiles.
meanings.sent3: The kids wanted to chequer their clubhouse walls with bright colors.
meanings.sent4: The gardener will chequer the garden beds with various plants.
meanings.sent5: He plans to chequer the ceiling with wooden beams for a rustic look.

meanings.definition: A small, flat piece of stone or wood used in board games
meanings.sent1: The player moved his chequer across the board to capture the opponent's piece.
meanings.sent2: She picked up a chequer to make her next move in the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat batted the chequer off the table during the game.
meanings.sent4: The chequer slid smoothly across the board as the game progressed.
meanings.sent5: He carefully placed the chequer on the winning square to claim victory.
